Art and Visual Style
description:
Decide on the look and feel of the game.

Things to decide together:
- Pixel art? Hand-drawn? Simple shapes (what we have now)?
- Top-down view (current) or isometric (angled like old Zelda)?
- Color palette — dark and moody? Colorful? Mix?
- Animations — walking, attacking, getting hit, dying
- Particle effects — sparks, explosions, magic
- Use free asset packs from kenney.nl or opengameart.org? Or draw our own?
- Sound effects and music? (could add later)

title: Leveling, XP, and Progression
description:
Design how the player gets stronger over time.

Things to decide together:
- How do you earn XP? (Killing monsters? Finding items? Exploring?)
- How much XP to level up? Does it increase each level?
- What happens when you level up? (Stat points to allocate? New abilities? HP increase?)
- Is there a max level?
- Skill trees or ability unlocks?
- Do you keep progress between dungeon runs (roguelike) or start fresh?

title: Dungeon Generation
description:
Design how the dungeon levels are built.

Things to decide together:
- Hand-designed levels or randomly generated each time?
- How big are the floors?
- Room types — treasure rooms, trap rooms, boss rooms, shops, rest areas?
- How are rooms connected? Corridors? Doors? Keys?
- Environmental hazards? (Lava, spikes, poison gas?)
- Secret rooms or hidden walls?
- Does the dungeon get harder as you go deeper?
- How many levels/floors before you 'win'?

title: Character Creation System
description:
Design the character creation screen where the player picks their hero before entering the dungeon.

Things to decide together:
- What races can you be? (Human, Elf, Orc... or something totally custom?)
- What classes? (Warrior, Mage, Rogue... or invent new ones?)
- What stats does a character have? (Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma — or different ones?)
- How many stat points do you get to allocate?
- Does your race or class give bonuses?
- What does the creation screen look like?
close_reason: Built character creation screen with Human race, Warrior/Wizard classes, male/female toggle, 5 face options, and 6-stat allocation (base 5, 3 bonus points)

title: Update create character with better face art.
Combat System
description:
Design how fighting works when the player encounters a monster.

Things to decide together:
- Turn-based or real-time?
- Dice rolls — what dice? d20 for attack rolls like D&D? Show the dice on screen?
- How does attack work? (Roll + STR modifier vs. enemy Defense?)
- How does defense work? (Armor class? Dodge chance?)
- Can you do special moves or spells?
- What happens when you die? Game over? Respawn? Lose items?

title: Monsters and Enemies
description:
Design the creatures that live in the dungeon.

Things to decide together:
- What types of monsters? (Goblins, Skeletons, Slimes, Dragons, Bosses?)
- Do monsters have levels? Do they scale with the player?
- What stats do monsters have? (HP, Attack, Defense, Speed?)
- Do different monsters have different behaviors? (Some charge, some shoot, some flee?)
- Boss fights — are there bosses at the end of levels?
- Do monsters drop specific loot?
- Monster designs — what do they look like? (We can sketch them out!)

title: Once someone finishes the game they have hard-mode accessible to them.
Support for extra party characters to show up later on in the game.
HUD and UI Design
description:
Design what the player sees on screen at all times.

Things to decide together:
- Health bar — what style? Hearts like Zelda? A bar? Numbers?
- Mini-map?
- Inventory quick-access bar (like Fortnite hotbar)?
- Stat display — always visible or press a key to see?
- Loot popup style — the rarity popup is in, but should it be bigger? Animated?
- Damage numbers floating up when you hit or get hit?
- What info is most important to see at a glance?

title: Loot and Item System
description:
Design the item and loot system — what you find, how it works, and what makes items exciting.

Things to decide together:
- Rarity tiers are in (Common/Uncommon/Rare/Epic/Legendary) — are these right? Change the names or colors?
- What kinds of items exist? (Weapons, armor, potions, rings, amulets, scrolls?)
- Do items have stats? (+3 Strength, +10 HP?)
- Can you equip items? How many slots? (Weapon, Shield, Helm, Armor, Ring, Boots?)
- Inventory screen — how does it look?
- Can you sell or drop items?
- Item sets or combos?
